column5: Lapse of judgment there, I'm usually really good with that stuff, lol.
I'm sorry, but I'm in a cheeky mood tonight.  No worries on the lack of reports, they won't be missed.
Back for seconds...  That water looks unreal.  Oh and shave your scruff ya hippy!!!
Indeed. My hands sweat profusely I need extra holes for ventilation.       When are you gonna join me again?
Your numbers are amazing. Beauty of a river with no crowds...very nice!  Fantastic post man!!!!   TDunn

I fished that area a bit on Tuesday and only got 1 coho to show for it (pretty sure I recognized some of the spots) I had the chance to go back on wed but passed. Guess that was a mistake.  Anyhow it looks like a fantastic day. So how much do you charge for guiding?
Coffee and a bit of gas.

You are unbelievable!    Do you ever go out and get skunked or catch one or two fish?  Good work again and fantastic report.  Me and my son went to that creek with the browns that you've done so well at lately and caught a handful of steelies but no browns up at the dam.  Had I known that it was that good up there, I would have gone up as well, but the son would have had a hard time with no waders.    Anyways I'm second in line for the guiding thing if you ever do start something.  Looking forward to your next adventure.  Mike G. Kingsalmon
When I can make it out to where you are brother..  soon!!  Until then I rely on the unwaveing faith that this nonsense with the mto will end..
Looks like the same trail
Wow Solo, another stellar day on the water!!!  Great looking fish.  Paul
Hey Harv, guess you didnt see me upriver landing fish tuesday huh???
Guess not....

Dickhead!  I just mentioned this to my wife. Her response - "Sure. why not?" - but after all these years of marital bliss I have learned to pay close attention to the subtle nuances of inflection and intonation underlying her most benign responses. The words unsaid were something like "Sure, go fishing, if you care nothing for the family jewels." She might have inflected & intoned "cojones" in deference to the upcoming winter sojourn but it all means the same thing, and it makes me squirm even thinking about it.  Besides, you'll have yer hands full keeping BillM out of trouble.  JF
Have you ever heard the expression "it's easier to apologize than it is to ask permission?"  No worries though, there'll be other opportunities.
I'm not concerned about begging forgiveness, it's regenerating cojones that worries me.  JF
John, I hope we get to share a few drifts in the near future..  Anytime on the water with Mike is an absolute riot, fish or no fish.
PANSY!!!!!
I hope so too. For this trip though you'll have to be the one laughing at Mike. I'll be home taking care of all the little bits 'n pieces.  JF
Yeah. So what's yer point?  JF

John famous words to live by for panseys     "Quando omni flunkus moritati"   You have had me fooled all this time , steel with Mike or ????? WHAT DO YOU THINK  TIGER  WOULD DO !!!  Sorry but gotta get your priorities set . IM A MAN I CAN CHANGE, IF I HAD , I GUESS.    encyclopediadramatica.com/Pussy-whipped  lmao  sorry john no hard feelings but" ITS STEEL WITH MIKE !!!!!!!!"
congrats mike what a day

It's been too long since latin class, but does that mean  "When all else fails, die" or "When snafued, there's always tomorrow."?  Duck & cover?  Seriously, today I suspect he'd stay home to do chores.  I could change, but then I'd be less a man. That should be translated into latin and hung above my door.  A real man isn't afraid to be seen giving in to his wife. The abuse we take from the lads is nothing compared to the heat SWMBO can rain down on our submissive heads. Of course a real man is seldom seen fishing but he also doesn't spend the better part of his life walking around with his hands cupped lovingly over "the boys".  Bravely cowering JF
WOW  That's all I can say..  WOW!
Great essay Mike! I see that you are using Tim's floats   I like them as well.
HOLYYYYYYYYYYYYY,.,...(bows down towards you)
I think they're called steelheads when they're all shiny like that.  JF

I don't yet understand why I continue to keep opening your fall reports.  They're punishment everytime.  Especially for those who can't escape at the moment.   Good fishing Paul and Mike.  And Bill... smarten up dood... haven't ya learned by now who's boss???
Oh Boy,...those are some Sweeet Pics...Musta got in right before the Storm....Bad move BillM,..It must hurt to read the post...lol
It does man, I have been looking forward to fishing that river for a long time..  I'm sure tomorrow will more then make up for it though.
They're forecasting a tsunami for tomorrow on that river. Ya might wanna think twice.  JF
So I guess even those who couldn't figure it out from the pictures now know where those fish were caught.......
Ya never heard of disinformation, or do you know something the rest of us didn't?  JF
Not anymore, my bad.
Darn it, there's a hole in your woolies.

Don't really know Harv, but we have mutual aquaintances. Ironically enough it was the report of Harv's day on Tuesday that made Bill bail.  (If one is astute enough to recognize the river then they already know it intimately)

Ya, Tuesday was a tough day - NO ONE on the river caught fish that day - EVERYONE caught fish on Wednesday - just one of those things!!!  One thing is for sure - there will be no more of those reports!!   Still no need to be naming rivers!!!  Thanks for deleting the post Bill.
Post edited.  (This particular post caused an unfortunate stir amongst a few individuals. While I don't agree with their point of view in the slightest, neither do I need the hassle.)

Again, top tier.  Great photos and fishing....the steelhead reports from you and others have forced me to rig up the float rod and stand stupidly in my living room holding it....3 more weeks.....   Keep it up Mike!

Oh boy, it's been a while since I last splashed around in those waters but knowing when and where to be on that river can result in a spectacular number of hook ups.  Of course I'm not telling you anything you don't already know.  Congrats on another stellar day of chrome.

Stop, dammit! Just stop!  I do not wanna see any more of yer friggin' inflammatory artsy juxtapositions of tree-lined trails and roiling rivers salted with fish porn. If this keeps up I'm gonna have to leave early for Cancun. I'll need a beach fix to wash yer fishy dreamscapes from my mind. Besides, the ladies in Cancun are prettier than yer stinkin' feesh. I realize yer fish are topless too, but somehow it just ain't the same.  I may well go home and break my virgin 13 footer into little bitty pieces, toss it in the bag with all that oh-so-perfect-just-the-right-brand-and-size-still-in-the-package terminal tackle, don my nifty SoloPaddlerWannabe fingerless gloves and chuck the whole dammed mess in the garbage chute down the hall.  Bleah!!!  JF
Wow, fantastic like usual.   Thank you Mike for sharing.   FLEX

But John I thought you said yesterday the ladies in Cancun were old and lasivious?  If the opportunity presents itself I'd be honoured if you'd accompany me. Perhaps in the process we can de-virginize your rod.
A nice show of fall colour!

Why do you have to torment us like this??!!  I should be getting orders ready, and yet, I can't pull myself away from this desk for some unexplicable reason..  C'mon guys, enough of this fandangling..  HD
Too funny....    I'd jump all over this one John, can't go wrong!
sweet looking river and great fish! 8/9 on 9 casts?  C'monnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn!  Play fair!
Incredible... not much else to say... other then you should have a camera crew following you around
You're killing me, man.
I can only wish!  man, I envy you right now...

It's probably misleading to refer to any of them as ladies. As for age I'm not always certain as my eyes keep sliding below the neck for some reason. Some are easy to recognize as on the elderly side but yer eyes tend to then be drawn back above the neck, or away out across the water as like as not. All that being said a nice degree of lasciviousness can offset a little aging in a woman. But fetchingly lewd & lascivious works better in a smokey bar.  Any time you feel the need to introduce a newby to the mysteries of floatfishing just let me know. It may not be happening soon though as my wife has me booked solid for the rest of this week. Then business obligations have me in Toronto and otherwheres until next Thursday evening. Then we leave for Cancun just before New Years and won't be back in Canada till February.  I may have to settle for getting my fish fixes vicariously for the next while unless I get my butt out and dive with the sharks & eels while I'm down south.  JF

I cant even tell you how jealous I am.  That is an incredible day. I have never caught 8 steelies in a day let alone in my first 9 casts.  If you ever need a partner let me know....anytime, anywhere! Obviously youd be doing the teaching!!  Cheers and thanks again for an incredible report.

Trust me, if Mike was to call today and suggest a trip to the river I'd jump thru hoops to make it happen. My problem is I have a wife and business associates who will all be looking to neuter me if I drop the ball any time before next Friday am. The scariest is my wife. The rest are just executives and politicians, no one really threatening.  JF
Great stuff again Mike ! You may wanna take a hard look at what the lad that was already wading was wearing though.. and heed his attire! Deer season is open ya know....

I'm sure that Mike is not making this a limited time offer John. Whether it be next spring or next fall, just take him up on the offer when you can. I guarantee you'll devirginize that float rod on your first outing with Mike.
Wayne, that was pictures of myself and Paul wearing the blaze orange. We took it off when we started fishing.
What more can be said?  Had a great day Wednesday myself, but, fish on the first nine drifts?????????  Amazing!!!!!!!!
Exactly Chris.  On that note how do you feel about Saturday John?
Oh boy, this weekend is going to be fun  I'm still pissed I made the wrong call!!!!!!!!!!

Yeah bud, tomorrow is gonna rock.  For those that don't know Bill was supposed to join Paul and myself on Wed. A mutual friend called him Tues evening and told him that a very good source had fished the river on Tues and caught one fish. Said don't waste your time. So Bill bailed....  I never let other peoples lack of success act as a barometer for my potential choice of spots.  Hope ya learned your lesson!
Agreed...I almost prefer not to hear about somebody elses day on the river I am going to fish...the anticipation is half of the fun...also no false hopes or expectations.
Oh trust me,  this one is going to sting for a while.
